byline.contributor: Rami Nazzal contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Omar Zayed, 52, had been living in Bulgaria after he escaped in 1990 from custody in Israel, where he was convicted of killing a yeshiva student.

headline.print_headline: Palestinian Fugitive Is Found Dead in Bulgarian Capital
headline.main: Palestinian Fugitive Found Dead Outside Embassy in Bulgaria

snippet: Omar Zayed, 52, had been living in Bulgaria after he escaped in 1990 from custody in Israel, where he was convicted of killing a yeshiva student.
abstract: Omar Zayed, Palestinian man who escaped prison in Israel in 1994, is found dead outside Palestininan Embassy in Bulgarian capital of Sofia; Zayed,  who was sentenced to life in prison for 1986 murder of yeshiva student Eliyahu Amedi,  was taking shelter in embassy since December, fearing extradition to Israel; cause of death is unclear.
